page.title: 17Worth: General survey.
page.content: Worth, a village just South of Sandwich, has a population of 748 people over 18. It has a shop, a school 2 pubs, a Parish Hall, and a pond. The shop is a general store and P.O. The church is 11th century, has a lych- gate and choir, and shares a vicar with Staple and Woodnesborough churches. The school is Worth County Primary School and has a total of 46 pupils, and two full time teachers. It has a small swimming pool. This Easter holiday the parents and teachers re- decorated the interior of the school. The two pubs are called 'The Blue Pigeons' and 'The Crispin'. The Parish Hall used to belong to the church. Now the Parish of Worth owns it and all the villagers can use it. In the last few months some of the villagers have lowered the hall ceiling rewired it and decorated it.
